utterance: Get out of the room, you drunken vagabond!
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Damme, Polly, I will! I'll sell him to-morrow morning; and if I can't sell him I'll give him away.
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: No; I tell you, I'll sell him.-'Misery in his back!' the mischief! he's a drunken, trifling, goodfor-nothing nigger! and I have sworn to sell him a thousand-yes, ten thousand times; and now I'll have to do it to keep my word.
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: didn't none on 'em hol' a candle to his young mistis, whar wuz de ve'y pink an' flow'r on 'em all.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: Colonel,
speaker: Bob

utterance: there is a matter I want to speak to you about-a-ah-we-a little matter of great importance to-ah-myself.
speaker: Bob

utterance: Aha, you rogue, I knew it. Come up to the scratch, sir. So you are caught at last. Ah, you sly fox! It's the very thing you ought to do. Why, I know half a dozen girls who'd jump at you. I knew it. I said so the other night. Polly—
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: I want to ask your consent to marry Polly, I love her.
speaker: Bob

utterance: The devil you do!
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Yes, sir, I do, I love her, and I want her.
speaker: Bob

utterance: Well, sir, you can't have her!
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: I will!
speaker: Bob

utterance: I'll be if you shall! the King of England should not have her!
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: I will have her
speaker: Bob

utterance: Polly! do you want to marry Bob?
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Why, no
speaker: Polly

utterance: I knew it! It was a piece of cursed impertinence!
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Well, I'm glad we are not going to have any nonsense about the fellow; I have made up my mind, and we'll treat his impudence as it deserves
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Marse Bob'll walk heself to death
speaker: Charity

utterance: I didn't say anything
speaker: Polly

utterance: Oh, uncle!
speaker: Polly

utterance: Who dat out dyah?
speaker: Charity

utterance: You niggers better go 'long to bed.
speaker: Charity

utterance: Who dat out dyah, I say?
speaker: Charity

utterance: Whyn't you go 'long 'way from dat do'?
speaker: Charity

utterance: Torm, Torm, dee's somebody at de do'.
speaker: Charity

utterance:
Well, name o' Gord!
good Gord A'mighty!
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: Whar Marse Bob?
speaker: Charity and Torm

utterance: Hello, Torm! How are you, Mam' Charity?
speaker: Bob

utterance: Doesn't it smell sweet in here?
speaker: Polly

utterance: I don't smell anything but that mint bed you've been walking on.
speaker: Bob

utterance: Now be sure you tell him—nine o'clock.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Umm! I know he gwi' sell me den sho 'nough.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: What in the world have you got there?
speaker: Bob

utterance: Mint.
speaker: Polly

utterance: Name o' Gord, Torm, you gwine to scawl hawgs?
speaker: Charity

utterance: Miss Polly come home larse night; sh' say she breakfast at nine o'clock.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: He's turrible dis mornin'.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: he th'owed de whole kittle o' b'ilin' water at me.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: Pity he didn' scawl you to death.
speaker: Charity

utterance: Ef Marster meet Marse Bob dis mornin', de don' be a hide nor hyah left o'nyah one on 'em; an' dat lamb over dyah maybe got oystchers waitin' for him too.
speaker: Charity

utterance: He don' even quoil no mo'.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance:
He jes set still and study.
I 'feard he gwine 'stracted.
speaker: Drinkwater Torm

utterance: Where did you get this mint?
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Just one more squeeze.
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Damme if I don't sell you! or, if I can't sell you, I'll give you away—that is, if he'll come over and live with us.
speaker: the Colonel

utterance: Damme if I ever sell him again!
speaker: the Colonel
